bioghist.p: Frederic Mayer Bird was educated at the University of Pennsylvania, the Hartwick Lutheran Theological Seminary, and the Union Theological Seminary. He was ordained in the Lutheran church in 1861 and during the Civil War he served as a chaplain in the army. In 1869 he was ordained in the Episcopal church. After holding several posts, he was appointed Professor of Psychology, Christian Evidences, and Rhetoric at Lehigh University, in Pennsylvania (1881-1886). Bird was editor of Lippincott's Magazine from 1893 to 1898.
